reviews.text: Arrived at the Hotel to a friendly reception. Our room was #12 which was on the first floor with a balcony and a fantastic view. The room was clean and by European standards, spacious. The front desk people were always helpful with directions and also with booking a dinner up in the hills at a great trattoria. Yes it was a little noisy in the morning, but you have to remember you are in Italy now. The great breakfast was a super way to start the day. I would definitely stay here again on our next visit. One sour note was the Belvedere Restaurant in Monterosso which had ill mannered waiters and marginal food. So Rick Steves dropped the ball on this tratoria. But Rick was right on the money about Madame Dumonts chocolate in Brugge. One note for the parking lot. Driving in you will see a right turn for Fegini. Take this turn. The lot is at the end of this road.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel location can't be beat: it's right on the beach with gorgeous surrounding views. I requested and was given a room on the top floor, front of the hotel. The balcony had 180 degree views of the beach and mountains to the north and south. The room wasn't anything fancy, but large, comfortable and clean with high ceilings. The bathroom was sufficient, and I especially liked the ginger/orange skincare products offered- a nice touch.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast room was the most charming one we experienced during our two-week stay in Italy: large, mustard yellow walls with great furniture and art, and doors that opened onto the street/beach. The breakfast buffet served was adequate; but not the best we experienced in our travels.
